Package: com.android.build.gradle.api

[Java] Class ApkOutputFile

    • com.android.build.gradle.api.ApkOutputFile
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      OutputFile, java.io.Serializable

      public class ApkOutputFile

      Represents a resource output from a variant configuration. Depending on split requirements, there can be more than one output from aapt tool and each output file is represented by an instance of this class.

      • Constructor Summary

      • Method Detail

        • @Nullable public java.lang.String getFilter(java.lang.String filterType)

          Returns the split identifier (like "hdpi" for a density split) given the split dimension.

          Parameters:
          filterType - the string representation of {@see SplitType} split dimension used to create the APK.
          Returns:
          the split identifier or null if there was not split of that dimension.

        • @Nullable public java.lang.String getFilterByType(FilterType filterType)

        • @NonNull @java.lang.Override public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getFilterTypes()

        • @java.lang.Override @NonNull public java.util.Collection<FilterData> getFilters()

        • @NonNull public java.io.File getOutputFile()

        • @NonNull @java.lang.Override public java.lang.String getOutputType()

        • @NonNull public java.lang.String getSplitIdentifiers(char separatorChar)

          String identifying the splits within all the filters dimension. For instance, for a com.android.build.OutputFile.FilterType#DENSITY, a split identifier can be "xxhdpi". Each split identifier will be separated with the passed separator

          Parameters:
          separatorChar - separator for each filter's value.
          Returns:
          the split identifier (bounded by its split type).

        • @NonNull public OutputType getType()

        • @java.lang.Override public java.lang.String toString()
